sorular.soru: Are you allowed to merge here?

feedback.metin: If there is a right arrow on the road surface, you are only allowed to exit, even if there is block marking. You are not allowed to enter the main carriageway again.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: You may not stop next to a solid yellow line, which means parking is also forbidden. If the yellow line was broken, you would be allowed to stop, but parking would still be forbidden.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive here if you cannot go faster than 40 km/h due to engine trouble?

feedback.metin: Vehicles must be able and allowed to drive at least 50 km/h on an autoweg. Since your vehicle cannot go fast enough, you cannot drive here.

sorular.soru: In which situation do you have to let the lorry go first?

feedback.metin: Only in situation B do you have to let the lorry go first. Because you both want to enter the same side road, the rule applies where the driver turning right can go before the driver turning left. In situation A, you turn right, meaning you can go first. In situation B the lorry turns right and therefore you have to give way to the driver.

sorular.soru: At what distance from your car should you place a warning triangle?

feedback.metin: Warning triangles must always be clearly visible on the road. You should place a warning triangle at a distance of about 30 metres from the car and facing traffic travelling in the direction for which the car poses a danger.

sorular.soru: How fast are you allowed to drive here on the A4?

feedback.metin: Electronic signs or matrix signs indicate a speed limit for that particular lane. Sometimes different speeds may apply to different lanes, for example because traffic on the exit lane is approaching with less traffic nuisance than on the main carriageway, or vice versa. On the lane where you are driving, on the A4, a speed limit of 70 km/h applies.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: The C-2 sign indicates that this is a one-way street that is closed from this side to vehicles, horse riders and handlers of horses and livestock. The supplementary plate makes an exception for cyclists, snorfietsen, mopeds and speed pedelecs. You are not allowed to enter the road from this side in a passenger car.

sorular.soru: How many brake lights are mandatory on a passenger car?

feedback.metin: If you drive a passenger car in traffic, it must meet the legal requirements, which include three well-functioning brake lights.

sorular.soru: You cannot merge yet. Are you allowed to signal left at this point?
cevaplar: Yes. So other road users can make room for you.
No. Indicating before merging is not required.

feedback.metin: Try to observe traffic on the carriageway as early as possible to determine whether you have an opportunity to merge. Only indicate immediately before you actually merge. Merging is a special manoeuvre whereby you are required to give way to all traffic on the carriageway and merge safely without forcing space between traffic.

sorular.soru: Is driving after taking medication with a yellow sticker punishable by law?
cevaplar: Driving after using these medicines can be a criminal offence.
It is not punishable if they are prescribed by a doctor.
It is only punishable if you cause an accident.
sorular.dogruCevap: Driving after using these medicines can be a criminal offence.

feedback.metin: If you are taking medication with a yellow warning sticker, you are expected to know that this will affect your ability to drive. You are not allowed to drive if you know, or should know, that you are under the influence of a substance that affects your ability to drive. This is an offence and not only if you cause an accident. The fact that these medicines are prescribed by a doctor is irrelevant. Before using these types of medicines, ask your doctor or pharmacist for advice regarding your ability to operate a vehicle.

sorular.soru: Can you use a load carrier for goods other than those for which it is intended?

feedback.metin: If a load carrier has been constructed for the transport of specific goods, no other goods and no excess amount of these goods may be transported.

sorular.soru: Can you drive like this?

feedback.metin: You are still allowed to drive with a load obscuring your view in the rear-view mirror. In this case, however, you must have sufficient visibility in both wing mirrors. Note that the load should not obstruct operation of the vehicle and should not pose any unnecessary additional danger in the event of an accident.

sorular.soru: Is there an alcohol limit for a 2toDrive coach while supervising?

feedback.metin: If you are under 18 years old, you may only drive under supervision. This coach must be on your supervisor pass and must meet a number of requirements. For example, this person must be at least 27 years old and have had a Dutch driving licence for at least 5 years. Also, this person must not be under the influence of alcohol, drugs or medication. This person is an experienced driver and therefore falls under the 0.5 promille limit.

sorular.soru: Can you load and unload goods here?
cevaplar: Yes. No parking disc is required for this.
No. Only picking up or dropping off passengers is allowed here.
Yes. But you must use a parking disc.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. No parking disc is required for this.

feedback.metin: The blue line indicates a parking disc area, where drivers of motor vehicles with more than two wheels must display a parking disc to park legally. Loading and unloading goods and picking up and dropping off passengers is classed as stopping, rather than parking, and is therefore allowed here. A parking disc is not necessary for this.

sorular.soru: Can you adjust the exhaust system of your car to make more noise?

feedback.metin: The exhaust system of a passenger car may not make more noise than is stated in the vehicle registration register. You may not adjust the exhaust system in such a way that it will make more noise.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: Although the pedestrian is using an official pedestrian crossing, they do not have right of way. There are traffic lights, which take precedence over the traffic signs on the road surface. You have a green light, while the pedestrian has a red light and must therefore wait for the light to change.

sorular.soru: Should you walk around the front of the passenger car to get in?
cevaplar: No. You should walk around the back of the car.

feedback.metin: If you want to get into the vehicle, it is better and safer to walk in front of the vehicle. You will then see any approaching traffic coming in and you can take that into account. The road must, of course, be free because you may not obstruct anyone by opening your door.

sorular.soru: When should you indicate here?
cevaplar: As soon as the block marking starts.
As soon as you are on the merge lane.

feedback.metin: When driving in this lane, you must adapt your speed as much as possible to the traffic on the main carriageway. You must only indicate when you have a safe opportunity to join the main carriageway. After checking your blind spot again, you slowly move to the left.

sorular.soru: Are you obligated to indicate left here if you want to go around 3/4 of the roundabout?
cevaplar: No, but it is allowed and recommended.
Yes, you must indicate left from here.
No, you should never indicate left on a roundabout.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, but it is allowed and recommended.

feedback.metin: Roundabouts ensure traffic flows as smoothly as possible. You may indicate left at this point. Drivers approaching the roundabout will notice what you intend to do and can act accordingly. You must indicate right before leaving the roundabout as this improves traffic flow.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to run your full-beam headlights in this situation?

feedback.metin: You are driving in foggy weather during the day. During the day you are not allowed to run your full-beam headlights. Besides that, having your full-beam headlights turned on during foggy weather is inadvisable. The fog reflects the light and you can therefore blind yourself.

sorular.soru: Are you entering a 30 km-zone here?

feedback.metin: A recommended speed of 30 km/h is indicated here. This is not a 30km zone. The speed limit is 50 km/h, but it is wise to drive only 30km/h.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive with a defective right mirror?
cevaplar: No. Only with a defective left mirror.
No. No mirror may be defective.
Yes. But not with a defective left mirror.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. No mirror may be defective.

feedback.metin: A passenger car must have a functioning and undamaged left and right wing mirror and rearview mirror.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this warning light comes on?
cevaplar: Keep driving until you can stop safely, then call a garage or breakdown service.
Stop immediately. Continuing to drive may lead to serious damage to your vehicle.
Keep driving and report the malfunction at the next required APK.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep driving until you can stop safely, then call a garage or breakdown service.

feedback.metin: If the "engine management malfunction" warning light comes on you are advised to call a garage or breakdown service. If the vehicle is still operating normally, and the light is orange – not red – you are not required to stop immediately. Calmly find a safe place to stop. If you notice that the vehicle loses power or malfunctions in any way, you should stop immediately.

sorular.soru: Can you overtake the tractor here?

feedback.metin: The F-1 sign means: motor vehicles may not overtake each other. This ban applies to all motor vehicles. Tractors are also motor vehicles and therefore may not be overtaken.

sorular.soru: Should you conduct to a blood test upon request?

feedback.metin: If you are unable or unwilling to participate in a breath test to detect the use of alcohol or if the police suspect that you have used drugs or medicines, you must cooperate in a blood test.

sorular.soru: Which lights should you use in the city at night?

feedback.metin: In the dark and when visibility is seriously obstructed, you should use dipped headlights.

sorular.soru: On which lanes of the motorway are you allowed to drive with a vehicle and trailer of 8 metres in length?

feedback.metin: When driving a vehicle and trailer with a combined length exceeding 7 metres, you may only use the two right-most lanes on a motorway. If the rush-hour lane is open, this is considered another lane. Your vehicle combination may only use the rush-hour lane and the lane next to it. In this case, you can only use lanes 3 and 4.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the other vehicle?

feedback.metin: The F-5 sign indicates that you must give way to oncoming traffic. The blue passenger car is allowed first.

sorular.soru: Will you encounter equal-level junctions on an autoweg?
cevaplar: Yes. But only regulated by traffic lights.

feedback.metin: Equal-level junctions are places where roads cross each other without a bridge or viaduct. You will not find them on motorways, but you can find them on autowegen. They are usually not regulated by traffic lights but rather with traffic signs or priority triangles.

sorular.soru: What is the danger in this situation?
cevaplar: That you are overtaken on the right by a cyclist.
That you do not see a crossing pedestrian.
That the bus returns to the right.
sorular.dogruCevap: That you do not see a crossing pedestrian.

feedback.metin: The bus is obstructing your view of the left-hand side of the pedestrian crossing. You cannot clearly see whether a pedestrian is already crossing or about to cross the road. This means you may not be able to brake in time should you encounter a pedestrian. The bus is turning left and is unlikely to change course at this point. If a cyclist overtakes you on the right, this will not present any imminent danger due to the available cycle lane. The cyclist will be safe as long as you do not enter the cycle lane.

sorular.soru: The traffic jam is moving very slowly. What is the best way to merge?
cevaplar: Keep driving with a small speed difference and look for a spot.
Wait at the beginning of the acceleration lane for an opportunity to merge.
Swiftly overtake the traffic jam on the acceleration lane and merge at the end.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep driving with a small speed difference and look for a spot.

feedback.metin: Merging is a special manoeuvre. This means traffic on the main carriageway has right of way, so you should never force a spot. Drive with a small speed difference alongside the traffic jam and calmly find a spot. Merge as soon as it is safe to do so. Do not stand still at the beginning and wait for a spot, nor drive along the traffic jam at high speed only to merge at the end.

sorular.soru: What kind of bend presents the lowest risk of an accident in case of excessive speed?
cevaplar: A bend with a positive road banking.
A bend with a negative road banking.
A bend without a road banking.
sorular.dogruCevap: A bend with a positive road banking.

feedback.metin: If you approach a bend too fast, you risk not making the bend and skidding. This risk is lowest at bends with a positive road banking. A positive road banking means the outer bend is higher than the inner bend, so the centrifugal force is partially absorbed. On bends with a negative road banking, the opposite is true and the centrifugal force is somewhat increased.

sorular.soru: Should you expect a brommobiel here?

feedback.metin: You do not have to expect brommobielen here. Only vehicles that can and are allowed to travel at a speed of at least 50 km/h may use autowegen. Brommobielen are therefore not allowed on autowegen, regardless of whether they are within or outside of a built-up area and what the local speed limit is.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake on the right here?

feedback.metin: If the rush-hour lane is open, it is subject to the same standard rules as other lanes. Overtaking on the right is therefore forbidden, besides the usual exceptions such as traffic jams.

sorular.soru: Heavy snowfall has severely impaired visibility. Are you allowed to use the front fog lights?

feedback.metin: If the visibility is severely impaired due to rain, snow or fog, you are allowed to use the front fog lights.

sorular.soru: What should you do if your vehicle is no longer drivable after an accident on a motorway?
cevaplar: Try to push the vehicle to the hard shoulder.
Call breakdown assistance and warn traffic.
Get behind the crash barrier as quickly as possible and call 112.
sorular.dogruCevap: Get behind the crash barrier as quickly as possible and call 112.

feedback.metin: If you are unable to continue your journey due to an accident and your vehicle is stationary on the motorway, you should get yourself to safety first. Leave any injured passengers in the car and get behind the crash barrier as soon as possible. Call 112 and explain where you are and what has happened. The road will be closed immediately, and emergency services will be advised. Do not distract the other traffic and do not warn other traffic. Do not try to push the vehicle to the emergency lane, as this is dangerous.

sorular.soru: Does maintaining enough distance have a positive effect on your energy consumption?

feedback.metin: Maintaining enough distance has a positive effect on your energy consumption, as it ensures that you brake less and can drive at a more consistent speed than with a short following distance.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive 90 km/h here?

feedback.metin: The sign indicates that the autoweg ends here. This means you are driving on a normal road outside the built-up area. The speed limit is 80 km/h here.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: The cyclist is continuing on the road you want to exit. Through traffic on the same road has priority over traffic turning off.

sorular.soru: Can you transport a child of 2 years old for a short distance without a child restraint system?

feedback.metin: Normally, children under the age of 18 and less than 1.35 metres must be transported in a child restraint system. For children under the age of 3 years, there are no exceptions to this rule. Children 3 years of age or older may be transported in the back in occasional cases and over short distances when using a seat belt only. This does not apply when a parent drives the car or is the owner or holder of the car.
